data.chText: （因寒冷、害怕或激动）发抖，打颤，战栗
data.enText: to shake because you are cold or frightened, or because of a strong feeling

data.chText: 只要一想起那场事故，我就发抖。
data.enText: Just thinking about the accident makes me shudder.

data.chText: 她一个人待在车里，害怕得直哆嗦。
data.enText: Alone in the car, she shuddered with fear.

data.chText: 一想到我闯的祸，就不寒而栗。
data.enText: I shuddered at the thought of all the trouble I'd caused.

data.chText: 想想这一切得花多少钱，我就发怵。
data.enText: I shudder to think how much this is all going to cost (= I don't want to think about it because it is too unpleasant) .

data.chText: 公共汽车剧烈地晃动着停了下来。
data.enText: The bus shuddered to a halt.

data.chText: （因寒冷、害怕或反感等引起的）发抖，打颤，战栗
data.enText: a shaking movement you make because you are cold, frightened or disgusted

data.chText: 她不由自主地抖了一下。
强烈的震动；剧烈的抖动
电梯猛震一下，升上去了。
data.enText: The elevator rose with a shudder.

means: (因寒冷、害怕或激动)发抖，打颤，战栗
(因寒冷、害怕或反感等引起的)发抖，打颤，战栗

tr: an involuntary vibration (as if from illness or fear)
an almost pleasurable sensation of fright
example: a frisson of surprise shot through him
The children are shivering--turn on the heat!

tr: tremble convulsively, as from fear or excitement

value.def: If you shudder, you shake with fear, horror, or disgust, or because you are cold.

example.ex: Lloyd had urged her to eat caviar. She had shuddered at the thought...
example.tran: 劳埃德鼓动她吃鱼子酱。可她一想到这个就打哆嗦。

value.tran: (因担忧、恐惧、厌恶或寒冷)发抖，打颤，战栗

value.def: If something such as a machine or vehicle shudders, it shakes suddenly and violently.

example.ex: The train began to pull out of the station — then suddenly shuddered to a halt...
example.tran: 火车渐渐驶出了车站，然后突然猛震几下停了下来。

example.ex: The whole ship shuddered and trembled at the sudden strain.
example.tran: 突然的拉力使得整只船剧烈颤动。

value.tran: (机器、交通工具等)强烈震动，剧烈抖动

value.def: If something sends a shudder or shudders through a group of people, it makes them worried or afraid.

example.ex: The next crisis sent a shudder of fear through the UN community...
example.tran: 接下来的危机让联合国各成员国都很担忧。

example.ex: The word still causes a shudder among some of my students.
example.tran: 那消息还是让我的一些学生很害怕。

value.def: If you say that you shudder to think what would happen in a particular situation, you mean that you expect it to be so bad that you do not really want to think about it.

example.ex: I shudder to think what would have happened if he hadn't acted as quickly as he did.
example.tran: 我不敢设想如果他没有反应那么快的话会发生什么事。

value.tran: 不敢设想;想到…不寒而栗
